Package com.accele.gage.gfx

Class Texture

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.accele.gage.gfx.Texture
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cleanable, Indexable
    public class Texture
extends java.lang.Object
implements Indexable, Cleanable
    The Texture class is used as a way to render images to the screen.

    GAGE works with images through the use of textures. Textures can be applied to models which are then rendered to the screen. The same texture can be used with multiple models. All textures used in the engine must be registered in the texture Registry. Textures do not need to be manually cleaned, bound, or otherwise processed; all texture processing is handled by the Graphics instance.

    Textures can also spawn sub-textures which contain the exact same properties as the parent texture, just with a different position and area on the original image. To create sub-textures (also called sub-regions), use any variant of the subRegion() method.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    William Garland

    • Constructor Detail

      • Texture

        public Texture​(java.lang.String registryId,
               Resource<TextureMeta> meta)
        Creates a new Texture with the specified registryId and metadata.

        When creating a new Texture, it must be registered in the texture Registry in order for GAGE to keep track of it throughout the life cycle of the engine.

        To load a texture from a file (e.g. BMP, PNG, etc.), several different ResourceLoaders are provided in the ResourceLoaders class.

        Parameters:
        registryId - the unique ID to use in the texture Registry
        meta - the metadata for the Texture

    • Method Detail

      • bind

        public void bind​(int sample)
        Binds the Texture to the current graphics context along with the specified active texture unit.
        Parameters:
        sample - the active texture unit to use with this Texture

      • subRegion

        public Texture subRegion​(java.lang.String registryId,
                         float x,
                         float y,
                         float width,
                         float height)
        Returns a view of this Texture with a new registryId and within the specified dimensions on the original texture.

        While this method does technically return a new Texture object, it does not create a new OpenGL texture to use with it; it is simply a view of the original texture. Because of this, despite this sub-texture having a registry ID, it should not be registered in the texture registry because the registry would then attempt to clean both the sub-texture and the parent texture. The registry ID of the sub-texture serves only to mark the texture with a unique identifier for user purposes.

        Parameters:
        registryId - the unique ID to use to identify the Texture
        x - the upper-left x-coordinate on the original image to use in the sub-texture
        y - the upper-left y-coordinate on the original image to use in the sub-texture
        width - the width of the view on the original image to use in the sub-texture
        height - the height of the view on the original image to use in the sub-texture
        Returns:
        a view of this Texture with a new registryId and within the specified dimensions on the original texture

      • subRegion

        public Texture subRegion​(float x,
                         float y,
                         float width,
                         float height)
        Returns a view of this Texture with a new registryId and within the specified dimensions on the original texture.

        While this method does technically return a new Texture object, it does not create a new OpenGL texture to use with it; it is simply a view of the original texture. Because of this, despite this sub-texture having a registry ID, it should not be registered in the texture registry because the registry would then attempt to clean both the sub-texture and the parent texture. The registry ID of the sub-texture serves only to mark the texture with a unique identifier for user purposes. The registry ID of the sub-texture will be the registry ID of the original texture followed by _sub_region_x_y_width_height, where x, y, width, and height denote the values passed in to their respective parameters.

        Parameters:
        x - the upper-left x-coordinate on the original image to use in the sub-texture
        y - the upper-left y-coordinate on the original image to use in the sub-texture
        width - the width of the view on the original image to use in the sub-texture
        height - the height of the view on the original image to use in the sub-texture
        Returns:
        a view of this Texture with a new registryId and within the specified dimensions on the original texture

      • clean

        public void clean()
        Description copied from interface: Cleanable
        Allows the implementer to perform any necessary cleanup tasks. For most engine-specific resources, this method should not be called manually as it is usually always called after stop() has been called.
        Specified by:
        clean in interface Cleanable

      • getRegistryId

        public java.lang.String getRegistryId()
        Description copied from interface: Indexable
        Returns the registry ID to use in the Registry. This ID must be unique within the registry.
        Specified by:
        getRegistryId in interface Indexable
        Returns:
        the registry ID to use in the Registry

      • getTotalWidth

        public int getTotalWidth()
        Returns the total width of the Texture.

        In a sub-texture, this value will always be consistent with its parent texture.

        Returns:
        the total width of the texture

      • getTotalHeight

        public int getTotalHeight()
        Returns the total height of the Texture.

        In a sub-texture, this value will always be consistent with its parent texture.

        Returns:
        the total height of the texture

      • getX

        public float getX()
        Returns the upper-left x-coordinate of the Texture.

        For original textures (non-sub-textures), this value will always be 0.

        Returns:
        the upper-left x-coordinate of the Texture

      • getY

        public float getY()
        Returns the upper-left y-coordinate of the Texture.

        For original textures (non-sub-textures), this value will always be 0.

        Returns:
        the upper-left y-coordinate of the Texture

      • getWidth

        public float getWidth()
        Returns the width of the Texture.

        For original textures (non-sub-textures), this value will always be 1.

        Returns:
        the width of the Texture

      • getHeight

        public float getHeight()
        Returns the width of the Texture.

        For original textures (non-sub-textures), this value will always be 1.

        Returns:
        the width of the Texture
